JUDGES: Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before ORG by Ms PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , ORG Attorney - General .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE an insurance company ( PERSON . ) instituted proceedings against the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Okrožno sodišče v PERSON ) gave a first - instance judgment . An appeal was lodged .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON v PERSON ) gave a judgment upholding the first - instance court ’s judgment . The applicant lodged an appeal on points of law .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a supervisory appeal under the Act on the Protection of the Right to a Trial without undue Delay ( “ the CARDINAL Act ” ) with ORG . The supervisory appeal was rejected .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a motion for deadline .
The proceedings are still pending before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against an insurance company ( PERSON . ) seeking compensation for damages occurred at the working place .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a judgment . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision and remitted the case for re - examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE a first - instance judgment was issued . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the first - instance court ’s judgment . The applicant lodged an appeal on points of law .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave a judgment . The judgment was served on the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . For relevant domestic law see the ORG ’s decision GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . In addition , the LAW to LAW without undue Delay ( Zakon o spremembah in dopolnitvah PERSON o varstvu pravice do sojenja brez nepotrebnega odlašanja , ORG , No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) came into effect on CARDINAL DATE . Section CARDINAL provides that a just satisfaction claim can be lodged after the termination of the proceedings before ORG , provided that the acceleratory remedies , that is supervisory appeal and a motion for a deadline , have been exhausted .
